revisions.rev:
{{Refimprove|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox Strictly Come Dancing Series | season_name = Strictly Come Dancing (series 9) | image = | celebrity_winner = | professional_winner = | country = [[United Kingdom]] | network = [[BBC One]] | first_aired = {{dts|10 September 2011}} (Launch Show)
{{start date|30 September 2011}} | last_aired = present (Live Shows) | num_episodes = 17 (as of {{dts|20 November 2011}}) | prev_series = [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 8)|Series 8]] | next_series = }} The ninth series of '''''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]''''' began on 10 September 2011 with a Launch Show,[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s104/strictly-come-dancing/news/a338005/dolly-parton-to-play-strictly-come-dancing-red-carpet-launch.html [[Dolly Parton]] to play Strictly Come Dancing red carpet launch] and the live shows started on 30 September and 1 October 2011. The show was broadcast from [[Wembley Arena]] on 19 November with all proceeds going to the BBC charity, [[Children in Need]].[http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/strictlycomedancing/2011/07/strictly-come-dancing-from-wem.shtml Strictly Come Dancing from Wembley] The final will take place at the [[Blackpool Tower| Blackpool Tower Ballroom]], will be the first episode in [[3D television|3D]], and will also be shown on [[BBC HD]]. As in [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 8)|Series 8]] there are 14 couples with one new male professional, [[Pasha Kovalev]], replacing [[Jared Murillo (dancer)|Jared Murillo]]. The Saturday show is presented by Sir [[Bruce Forsyth]] and [[Tess Daly]], while the Sunday results show is presented by Daly with [[Claudia Winkleman]]. Former contestant [[ZoÃ« Ball]] replaces Winkleman as the regular host of the spin-off show ''It Takes Two'' due to Winkleman's family commitments.[http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/868463-zoe-ball-to-present-strictly-come-dancing-spin-off-it-takes-two Zoe Ball to present Strictly Come Dancing spin off It Takes Two] On 5 and 6 November [[Jennifer Grey]], the winner of the eleventh series of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'', the American version of 'Strictly', was a guest judge, replacing [[Len Goodman]] while he had a week off.[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s104/strictly-come-dancing/news/a346535/dirty-dancing-jennifer-grey-to-guest-judge-strictly-come-dancing.html Dirty Dancing Jennifer Grey to guest judge Strictly Come Dancing] In Goodman's absence, [[Craig Revel Horwood]] was Head Judge. The full lineup of celebrities was revealed on 6 September 2011 on ''[[The One Show]]''.[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s104/strictly-come-dancing/news/a338953/strictly-come-dancing-2011-lineup-revealed-lulu-jason-donovan-holly-valance-mcflys-harry-judd.html Strictly Come Dancing 2011 Lineup Revealed: Lulu, Jason Donovan, Holly Valance, McFly's Harry Judd ] As in the previous series, the celebrities did not know who would be their professional partner until they were introduced to each other at the Launch Show. ==Couples== {| class="wikitable" style="margin:auto; text-align:center; font-size:100%;" ! {{Strictly Come Dancing table key}} * '''Week 1''' - Night 1: 7 of the 14 couples performed either a Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha, there was a tie for top of the leader board between Holly & Artem and Anita & Robin both scoring 28/40 for their Cha-Cha-Cha and Waltz respectively. Lulu finished bottom of the leaderboard with 17/40 for her take on the Cha-Cha-Cha after forgetting the steps. * '''Week 1''' - Night 2: The remaining 7 couples performed again a Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha. Jason & Kristina triumphed with their Cha-Cha-Cha and finished top of the leaderboard for both nights with 32/40. Nancy & Anton suffered a wardrobe malfunction and as a result landed bottom with just 12/40 and a 1 from Craig. * '''Week 2''' - This week, all 14 couples performed either a Foxtrot or a Salsa. Jason & Kristina topped the leaderboard for the second week running with a score of 33/40. Also for the second week running, Nancy & Anton came bottom of the leaderboard, this time with only 14/40. Audley & Natalie and Edwina & Vincent were voted into the bottom two, with the latter couple leaving the competition for good. * '''Week 3''' - Week 3 was Broadway week for Strictly, and the couples each performed one unlearned dance. For the third week running, Jason & Kristina's Tango gave them the top spot with a score of 36/40. Nancy & Anton's Tango landed them bottom of the leaderboard with 20/40, and they found themselves in the bottom two. However, it was Dan & Katya who were eliminated from the competition after scoring 24/40 for their Viennese Waltz. * '''Week 4''' - Week 4 saw the 12 remaining couples perform an unlearned dance. This week, Chelsee & Pasha's Quickstep gave them the top spot on the leaderboard, whilst the first ten of the series was awarded for Harry & Aliona's Waltz. Nancy & Anton once again fell to the bottom of the leaderboard with only 18/40 for their Paso Doble, and landed in the bottom two for the second week running. But it was Rory & Erin who were eliminated after scoring 24/40 for their Cha-Cha-Cha. * '''Week 5''' - This week, the remaining 11 couples took to the floor with a [[Halloween]]-themed routine. Jason & Kristina shot back up to the top of the leaderboard with a score of 37, whilst last week's highest scorers Chelsee & Pasha received 32 points for their Tango. Nancy & Anton took the bottom spot for the fifth week running, and were eliminated from the competition after a bottom two with Audley & Natalie. * '''Week 6''' - For week 6, [[Dirty Dancing]] star [[Jennifer Grey]] replaced Len Goodman on the panel and the remaining 10 couples took to the floor. Chelsee & Pasha regained the top spot with 36/40 for their Charleston whilst Jason & Kristina found themselves 4th from the bottom with their Rumba. On the results show, Audley & Natalie found themselves in the bottom two for the third time, along with Lulu & Brendan, the latter of whom was eliminated. * '''Week 7''' - Due to an injury in his back, Artem missed out this week and Brendan Cole stepped in to partner Holly.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/strictlycomedancing/2011/11/artem.shtml|title=BBC - Strictly Come Dancing: Injury rules Artem out of this week's show|work=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=11 November 2011}} Harry & Aliona took the top spot of the leaderboard for the first time in the series with a score of 37/40 for their Argentine Tango. Audley & Natalie fell to the bottom with only 20/40 for their Cha-Cha-Cha, which gave them a place in the bottom two alongside Anita & Robin (despite receiving 33/40 for their Argentine Tango). The former couple were subsequently eliminated. *'''Week 8''' - This week, Strictly came live from [[Wembley Arena]] and the remaining 8 couples danced to a theme of 'Best of British'. Alex & James and Chelsee & Pasha were tied at the top of the leaderboard with 35/40 for their Tango and Samba respectively. Despite being flown in from a cannon, Russell & Flavia fell into last place with 24/40 for their Jive, and were eliminated from the competition after being joined in the bottom two by Holly & Artem. *'''Week 9'''- Week 9 had two rounds of competition: the individual unlearned dance round, and then a Swing-a-thon. Harry & Aliona scored the highest score of the season, 39/40, for their Quickstep. Harry & Aliona also won the swing-a-thon, giving them a total of 46/47 for the night, whilst Robbie & Ola came bottom with 26/47. Anita danced with Brendan this week as Robin had a foot injury. Both Holly & Artem and Anita & Brendan found themselves in the bottom two for the second time, and Anita & Brendan were eliminated. *'''Week 10'''- Movie Night was the theme for the Quarter-Finals. Holly & Artem scored their first 10s for their Paso Doble, giving them the highest score for a Paso Doble so far this series with 38/40. However, Chelsee & Pasha reclaimed the top of the leaderboard with a near perfect Jive, scoring 39/40. Robbie & Ola were once again at the bottom of the leader board, with 30/40 for their Quickstep and landed in the bottom two with Jason & Kristina. Robbie & Ola were eliminated. ===Average chart=== The scores for the Swing-a-Thon in Week 9 have not been included as it was not scored on the traditional 40 point scale. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; margin: 5px; width: 90%" |-{{Unicode|}} ! Waltz | Salsa | Viennese Waltz |style="background:darkgray;" colspan="19"| |- |Edwina & Vincent | Cha-Cha-Cha | Foxtrot |style="background:darkgray;" colspan="20"| |} * '''Week 1''': Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha * '''Week 2''': Foxtrot or Salsa * '''Week 3''': One unlearned dance, including Viennese Waltz, Jive, Quickstep, Tango or Rumba (Broadway Night) * '''Week 4''': One unlearned dance, including American Smooth, Paso Doble or Samba * '''Week 5''': One unlearned dance (Halloween Night) * '''Week 6''': One unlearned dance, including Charleston * '''Week 7''': One unlearned dance, including Argentine Tango * '''Week 8''': One unlearned dance ([[Wembley Arena|Wembley]] Week) * '''Week 9''': One unlearned dance & Swing Marathon * '''Week 10''': One unlearned dance (Movie Night) * '''Week 11''': Two unlearned dances (Semi-final Night) ==TV Ratings== Weekly ratings for each show on [[BBC1]]. Figures exclude the BBC HD Channel.
